The girl is wearing a white tiara, white ball gown, and pink tennis shoes; the boy wears a gray shirt with black sleeves, and blue jeans. On their image, the words "A Cinderella Story" and "Original Soundtrack" are written in blue, bold font. | Border = yes | Released = July 13, 2004
(see [[#Release history|release history]]) | Recorded = 1997â2004 | Genre = [[Pop music|Pop]], [[pop rock]], [[dance-pop]], [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]] | Length = 49:17 | Label = [[Hollywood Records|Hollywood]] | Producer = [[Chico Bennett]], Julian Bunetta, [[Rob Cavallo]], [[Desmond Child]], Andy Dodd, Johnny Douglas, [[Ron Fair]], [[Dave Jerden]], Sherry Kondor, Ginger McCartney, [[Charlie Midnight]], Charlton Pettus, [[Matt Serletic]], Spider, Adam Watts, Denny Weston Jr. | Chronology = [[Hilary Duff]] soundtracks | Last album = ''[[The Lizzie McGuire Movie (soundtrack)|The Lizzie McGuire Movie]]''

(2004) | Next album = ''[[What Goes Up: Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]]''
(2009) | Misc = {{Singles | Name = A Cinderella Story | Type = soundtrack | Single 1 = [[Our Lips Are Sealed#Hilary and Haylie Duff version|Our Lips Are Sealed]] | Single 1 date = June 1, 2004 }} }} '''''A Cinderella Story: Original Soundtrack''''' is a soundtrack album by [[Hilary Duff]], released on July 13, 2004 by [[Hollywood Records]]. The album was released to accompany the 2004 film ''[[A Cinderella Story]]'', which starred Duff. She contributed five songs to the soundtrack including a cover of "[[Our Lips Are Sealed#Hilary and Haylie Duff version|Our Lips Are Sealed]]" with sister [[Haylie Duff|Haylie]], which peaked at #8 in Australia. It was praised by critics for being "admittedly lightweight but solidly entertaining." ''A Cinderella Story: Original Soundtrack'' peaked in the top ten in Canada and the United States (where it also topped ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'''s Top Soundtracks chart), and at #37 in Australia. == Album history == ''A Cinderella Story: Original Soundtrack'' was released to accompany Duff's 2004 film ''[[A Cinderella Story]]''. Duff contributed three new songs to the soundtrack, a duet with her sister [[Haylie Duff|Haylie]], a cover of "[[Our Lips Are Sealed#Hilary and Haylie Duff version|Our Lips Are Sealed]]" by [[The Go-Go's]], and the song "Anywhere but Here," taken from her debut album ''[[Metamorphosis (Hilary Duff album)|Metamorphosis]]'' (2003). Among other contributors to the soundtrack were [[Jesse McCartney]], [[MxPx]], [[MÃ½a]] and Haylie Duff, who recorded the song "One in this World" in addition to her duet with Hilary. "Hear You Me" by Jimmy Eat World was played in the movie, but was not released on the soundtrack, although it should have been. In the film [[Kara DioGuardi]] performs the song ''Now You Know'' while on the soundtrack Hilary Duff performs the song. Also in the film "Best Day of My Life" is performed by Robert Palmer and features Micheal Duff while on the soundtrack Jesse McCartney performs the song. The lyrics for "[[I'll Be (Edwin McCain song)|I'll Be]]" by [[Edwin McCain]] in the movie feature a different line in the chorus from the soundtrack, with "I'll be love's suicide" while the soundtrack's features "I'll be with the trappings of love" in the chorus. "Our Lips Are Sealed" was released as the first and only single from the album in June 2004. The Duffs' version peaked at #8 in Australia.{{cite web|url=http://acharts.us/song/2501|title=Hilary Duff and Haylie Duff - Our Lips Are Sealed|work=Î±Charts.us|accessdate=13 December 2009}} == Critical reception == {{Album ratings |rev1 = [[Allmusic]] |rev1score = {{Rating|3|5}}{{cite web|url={{Allmusic|class=album|id=r692624|pure_url=yes}}|title=A Cinderella Story > Review|last=Phares|first=Heather|work=[[Allmusic]]|publisher=Rovi Corporation|accessdate=10 December 2009}} }} Heather Phares of [[Allmusic]] gave a positive review of the soundtrack, awarding it three out of five stars. She praised Duff's songs, noting that they "display a little more edge and depth while still remaining appropriate for a [[teen pop]] singer like Duff and her audience," and added that they were complemented by the contributions from other artists. She claimed that Duff contributing to the majority of the album would "tide [her] fans over" before the release of her [[Hilary Duff (album)|eponymous third album]]. Phares finalized her review stating, "''A Cinderella Story'' is an admittedly lightweight but solidly entertaining soundtrack that delivers exactly what its audience wants from it." == Chart performance == ''A Cinderella Story: Original Soundtrack'' debuted and peaked at #9 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] chart in the United States; the album remained in the top 100 for eleven weeks.{{cite web|url=http://acharts.us/album/13465|title=Soundtrack - A Cinderella Story|work=Î±Charts.us|accessdate=13 December 2009}} It performed better on ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'''s Top Soundtracks chart, where it reached the top position.{{cite web|url={{Allmusic|class=album|id=r692624|pure_url=yes}}|title=A Cinderella Story > Charts & Awards > Billboard Albums|work=[[Allmusic]]|publisher=Rovi Corporation|accessdate=13 December 2009}} In Australia, ''A Cinderella Story'' debuted at #50 and peaked at #37 in its second week before dropping out of the top fifty its third week. In Canada, it peaked at #3. == Track listing == {{tracklist | writing_credits = yes | extra_column = Recording artist(s) | total_length = 49:17 | title1 = [[Our Lips Are Sealed#Hilary and Haylie Duff version|Our Lips Are Sealed]] | writer1 = [[Jane Wiedlin]], [[Terry Hall (singer)|Terence Hall]] | extra1 = [[Hilary Duff]], [[Haylie Duff]] | length1 = 2:40 | title2 = Anywhere But Here | writer2 = James Marr, Wendy Page, [[Chico Bennett]] | extra2 = Hilary Duff | length2 = 3:31 | title3 = The Best Day of My Life | writer3 = David Katz, [[Robert Palmer (singer)|Robert Palmer]], [[Lindy Robbins]] | extra3 = [[Jesse McCartney]] | length3 = 3:13 | title4 = Girl Can Rock | writer4 = Charlie Midnight, Denny Weston Jr. | extra4 = Hilary Duff | length4 = 3:11 | title5 = Now You Know | writer5 = [[Kara DioGuardi]], Charlton Pettus, [[Michelle Lewis]] | extra5 = Hilary Duff | length5 = 3:39 | title6 = One in this World | writer6 = [[Diane Warren]] | extra6 = Haylie Duff | length6 = 4:12 | title7 = Crash World | writer7 = [[Desmond Child]], [[Andreas Carlsson]], Julian Bunetta | extra7 = Hilary Duff | length7 = 3:01 | title8 = [[Make You Feel My Love|To Make You Feel My Love]] | writer8 = [[Bob Dylan]] | extra8 = [[Josh Kelley]] | length8 = 3:32 | title9 = [[Sympathy (song)|Sympathy]] | writer9 = [[John Rzeznik]] | extra9 = [[Goo Goo Dolls]] | length9 = 2:48 | title10 = Friend | writer10 = Kaitlyn Harner, Johnny Douglas | extra10 = Kaitlyn | length10 = 3:49 | title11 = [[Beautiful Soul (song)|Beautiful Soul]] | note11 = Cinderella Mix | writer11 = Andy Dodd, Adam Watts | extra11 = Jesse McCartney | length11 = 3:58 | title12 = [[I'll Be (Edwin McCain song)|I'll Be]] | writer12 = [[Edwin McCain|Edwin C.
